msgs.text: Proof of Work Bitcoin uses a Proof of Work consensus mechanism/security protocol. Proof of Work is a brilliant mechanism because it bridges a connection between the digital world of the Bitcoin network to the physical world we live. It does this through work/effort by means of electricity output through computational power executing the hashing algorithm called SHA-256. All users in a PoW system have an equal voice, no matter how much of the coin you own. If you run a node, you get a vote. Nodes validate transactions and miners lump those transactions into blocks and are incentivized to do so which secures the network. It is a synergistic system. Everyone works together and benefits.

Proof of Stake Proof of stake (PoS) protocols are a class of consensus mechanisms for blockchains that work by selecting validators in proportion to their quantity of holdings in the associated cryptocurrency. PoS consumes less energy than PoW, but this doesn't mean that PoW is a bad thing. More on this coming. PoS is vastly inferior to PoW when it comes to decentralization because with PoS, the largest bag holders get a larger stake in decisions concerning consensus rules. If you own most of the coins in a PoS protocol, your word means more than anyone else. This is not the case in a PoW system.

This article does a nice job explaining the differences:
https://www.bitdegree.org/crypto/tutorials/proof-of-work-vs-proof-of-stake#proof-of-stake-vs-proof-of-work-the-basics

Brilliant thread by Gigi detailing on the true value of PoW and how it is superior in every way to PoS.
"The chain with the most work is the truth. This is what we call Nakamoto Consensus."
https://twitter.com/dergigi/status/1392826448017346561?t=zl1RqlOy0zr33TwQBxVpZQ&s=19
